name: clumsily
content:
clumsily adverb
(without control)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not careful and controlled, and makes you likely to have accidents: He tripped clumsily on the rug and fell flat on his face. She pushed herself clumsily to her feet.
More examplesFewer examplesHer fingers fumbled clumsily with the lock.He staggered clumsily up and down the corridors.She lifted the hem of her skirt and curtsied clumsily.

clumsily adverb
(without thought)
in a way that does not show any skill or thought: The announcement was clumsily handled. She received a clumsily phrased love letter from a boy in her class. See
clumsy
More examplesFewer examplesHe phrased his comments clumsily.Then he changed the subject rather clumsily.I'm surprised by how clumsily they handled this.
